relatedanime.anime: Kuroko no Baske: Baka ja Katenai no yo!

category.name: School Life
category.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

category.name: High School
category.description:
The upper-secondary education (not compulsory in Japan) covers the grades ten, eleven, and twelve. The students are typically fifteen to eighteen years old.
Anime centre on High School settings predominately: Plot/story-wise the coming of age is of interest - the students are almost adults (their bodies have matured, see ecchi anime) with more earnest, real-life problems.

category.name: Clubs
category.description:
Even though school clubs in Japan are not mandatory, there is some pressure from the social grid (e.g. fellow students, teachers) to participate in some kind of after-school activity, be it in sports or arts. Colleges also have clubs.
As a comedy element in anime, some students have joined too many clubs, and are thus constantly stressed out. There is also the element of social commentary, making it clear that you have to join a club, if you want to be part of the class. Since self-founded clubs need at least 3 members, the desperate search and advertising for new members can be cause for hilarity in anime.

category.name: Basketball
category.description: Basketball is Netball for men, the real game that encourages dribbling and other such uncouth behaviour that was sanitised out of the ladies` version. However, it is itself woozy compared to Ulama, as the losing side are seldom publicly sacrificed.

category.name: Manga
category.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse.

category.name: Shounen
category.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word shounen refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. In Japanese, the word means simply "young male", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic. Still, while not mandatory, some easily identifiable traits are generally common to shounen works, such as: high-action, often humorous plots featuring male protagonists; camaraderie between male friends; sports teams and fighting squads (usually coupled with the aforementioned camaraderie); unrealistically attractive female characters (see fanservice). Additionally, the art style of shounen tends to be less flowery than that of shoujo and the plots tend to be less complex than seinen, but neither of those is a requirement.

character.name: Kagami Taiga
character.description: Kagami is a serious guy who grew up in America till 13. He hates how Japanese students plays basketball but decides to challenge "Kiseki no Sedai" since he believes that "You cant live a life without challenging strong opponents". He starts to hate kuroko since he plays extremely badly, and calls him a "bluff guy". but he changes his mind after seeing his impact in game. He turns on and tries harder when people make fun out of him and call him weak and often laughs when he looses to a strong person. even though he and Kuroko get along, he often starts a fight with him since Kuroko`s calm attitude gets on his nerves.

character.name: Kuroko Tetsuya
character.description: Kuroko (or Kurokochi as Kise calls him) is a short stiff guy who plays basketball worse than any amateur. But, he has one and only talent that makes him invincible: he has a great ability in misdirection and passing the ball, also due to his extremely small size and build (comparing to other players), he often gets ignored and therefore he can "hide" himself behind other regulars and distract them by ball movement so no one will notice he is there. the benefits of his invisible style, (as taiga calls it) makes him able to steal balls from players without them noticing he is around. He is known as the Invisible Phantom sixth of the famous group of middle schoolers, "Kiseki no Sedai". His Weak point is that he looses his effectiveness after 40 minutes and other players will get used to his presence.

character.name: Aida Riko
character.description: Aida is a daughter of a Sports trainer and has great ability in analyzing the body of people. Hyuuga thinks she sees everything in numbers and believes in her techniques so he made her to be the couch of the club.

character.name: Midorima Shintarou
character.description: Shintarou was Kiseki no Sedai`s best shooter, none of his teammates remember him to miss a shoot. He has a high keen to horoscopes and listens to oha saha horoscope every day and carries the lucky item they recommend. He believes that if you try hard, your fate will follow. He shows a huge attention to his fingers and always polishes and adjusts his nails and keeps them bandaged. Despite saying he dislikes Kuroko, he actually cares so deep about him (as his friend says) and always mentions that he highly respects Kuroko`s style of playing. It seems that he envies Kagami for being Kuroko`s new "light".

character.name: Kise Ryouta
character.description: Kise is a stunningly famous guy who was among Kiseki no Sedai. he has a great ability in copying the movement styles of his opponent. He works as a model for magazines due to his height and good looking face. unlike his manly looks, he has a childish manner comparing to his friends in the same age. Kise started basketball in the second year of middle school and is less experienced comparing to other players from Kiseki and claims to be the worst one among them. He shows high respect among Kuroko and feels sorry for him to be among the weak team of Teiko high. He believes that Basketball is the game of Size, but with all these, he tries to convince Kuroko to join their team. His Weak point is that he cant copy Kuroko`s game style and also is unable to do much when he cant see the movements of his opponent

character.name: Momoi Satsuki
character.description: Momoi was the manager of the basketball club in middle school. She has been in love with Kuroko since he gave her his winner ice cream stick.

character.name: Aomine Daiki
character.description: Daiki Aomine was one of the Generation of Miracles and was former partner/light of Kuroko in Teikou. Seirin suffered their first loss this season because of him. He now plays with Tohou High.
